intro: Glomera fuscosetosa, commonly known as the dark-hairy glomera, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which are often covered in a dense layer of fine pubescence. Its flowers are typically small and clustered, displaying a range of colors from white to pink. Glomera fuscosetosa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
